Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Orlando, FL. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

reactjs
.net
sql
c#
typescript

Job description

About this role:

Senior Software Engineers (specializing in front-end or back-end technologies, or well versed in both) are emerging leaders with a track record of delivering high-quality software that is scalable and maintainable. Our senior engineers must demonstrate deep empathy for our users, the business and a commitment to pragmatic execution for the development team.

What you would do in this role:

  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to the broader development team.
  • Build software for the broad suite of PowerDMS components, including:
    • Back-end: API’s, services, unit and integration tests, SQL queries, queues, cache, service bus, etc.
    • Front-end: UX components, unit tests, storybooks, client persistence, state management, etc.
  • Assist in the planning and definition of work that the team will perform.
  • Be accountable for the timely delivery of the work performed, and the quality, maintainability, and scalability of that work.
  • Communicate and manage expectations around risk, delivery, and performance with the scrum masters, product owners and senior leadership as necessary.
  • Exercise pragmatic urgency to advance the prioritized goals of PowerDMS.
  • Understand high-level expectations of product stakeholders.
  • Other duties as prescribed by the Build senior leadership.

What you need to know/have for this role:

  • At least 5 years of experience in software development.
  • If specializing in front-end technologies: Experience with major, current frameworks. We’re focusing on React with TypeScript, but we’ll consider experience with Angular 2+, Vue.js, etc.
  • If specializing in back-end technologies: Experience in the .Net Classic and .Net Core ecosystems using C#. Also: SQL Server, Redis, Elasticsearch are a big win.
  • Hands-on experience with a major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, Google, etc.).
  • Devops and related automation experience.
  • You must be highly organized and provide attention to detail.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Bachelor's Degree and/or equivalent relevant experience.

Physical/Mental Demands: 
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is frequently required to walk, stand, bend, kneel, stoop, communicate, reach and manipulate objects. The position requires mobility. Duties involve moving materials weighing up to 10 pounds on a regular basis such as files, books, office equipment, etc., and may infrequently require moving materials weighing up to 30 pounds. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating equipment such as computer keyboard, calculator, and standard office equipment. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.

Working Conditions: 
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential job functions of this job. Usual office working conditions: noise level in the work area is typical of most open-workspace office environments (with telephones, personal interruptions, and background noises) and of non-typical workspace environments (with music, cheering/clapping, loud laughter, and bell-ringing/horn blowing).

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

What we offer: 
A competitive salary; employer-paid medical and dental insurance for the employee; company-paid short and long term disability benefits and insurance policy; optional Life, AD&D, and Supplemental Insurance; Health Savings and Flexible Spending account options; Unlimited Paid Time Off plan; career development and mentoring; casual dress code every day; snack-stocked kitchen; flexible work schedules; employee engagement and reward programs; and a relaxed, flexible work environment that fosters a balance between hard work and fun.  

Sound like you?  Here’s what to do:

Please apply via our Careers page at http://www.powerdms.com/about/careers.aspx.  Select the position, click “Apply Now”, and then complete the online form.  From there, we will take a look at your resume and if we think it’s a match, we’ll contact you.  

PowerDMS/IDS =  DFWP/AA/EOE - M/F/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veteran

Apply now

About PowerDMS

Who we are:

PowerDMS is an Orlando-based SaaS company with a passion for helping organizations grow trust, integrity and accountability between themselves, their employees and the communities they serve. We take these values to heart, and our company and technology can be measured by and held to the same standards.

The PowerDMS platform is a single, secure, online location for the organization, management, and distribution of an organization’s most important documents. The software equips employees with essential job knowledge and know-how through electronic policy dissemination, accreditation management, and training capabilities–accessed anytime, from anywhere.

Relationships are a big deal to us—we care greatly for each other, our customers and our community. We believe a career is a huge part of life’s experience, so why not fill it with purpose, passion, and fun? We believe in hiring smart, fun people, inspiring them and getting out of their way. Maybe that’s part of the reason we’ve repeatedly been named one of Florida and Orlando’s “best places to work!”

Benefits

  • employer paid medical and dental insurance
  • company-paid short and long term disability benefits
  • Health Savings account options
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off plan
  • casual dress code every day
  • snack-stocked kitchen
  • Chef prepared meals, 3 times per week
  • flexible work schedules
  • gym reimbursement

Aptera works with clients across the United States and is headquartered in Fort Wayne, IN. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. For additional information about Aptera please visit our website at www.apterainc.com.

In 15 years, Aptera has expanded from 2 to 95 onsite employees in our Fort Wayne, Indiana office. We’ve done it organically through deep relationships with our clients and meaningful connections between team members. Our targets in terms of client partnerships are sophisticated in their adoption of technology to solve truly complicated business problems, and our expertise in design and development matches their needs. However, we also carry our Midwestern practicality with us, working alongside our clients as friends and taking a common sense approach to communication, collaboration, and problem solving.

We are a fully remote team based in Washinton, Oregon, Montana, California, Florida and Canada.

What we offer

  • A low ego environment where you can give and receive direct feedback.
  • Transparent leadership that openly shares the thinking behind company direction and strategy.
  • A flat organization where you are encouraged to contribute to company direction and strategy.
  • Stock in a company that has the potential to transform the way cannabis is bought and sold.

items.content:
Senior .Net Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Logistics & Distribution
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private
Company: ShipJunction | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

c#
javascript
postgresql
asp.net

Job description

You love coding and enjoy thinking about large scale technology ecosystems. Inefficiencies bother you.

We are a fast growing SaaS company that helps online retailers ship on autopilot. We are looking for a talented Software Architect that wants to be a part of, and have a large impact in the direction of a company.


You will have a broad scope of influence over the product roadmap so this position is ideally suited for you if you are motivated and rewarded by seeing the results of your contributions. You will be shipping code daily and will be able to see your hard work convert into revenue immediately. The ideal candidate will be a highly structured and process driven team member that can operate effectively in our fast paced and dynamic environment.


Requirements

  • Ability to thrive in a start-up environment
  • Ability and experience decomposing complex problems into solvable/explainable units
  • Write modular, tested and reasoned code
  • Comfort jumping into and comprehending a large codebase in a short time
  • Expert level C# knowledge
  • Comfort with Git
  • Comfort with Linux
  • Extensive database experience (query tuning, interacting with a database in a performant manner)
  • ORM experience


Bonus points with the following

  • Expert level Git knowledge
  • Postgres experience
  • Experience with multi-threaded systems
  • Experience with work queue systems

Qualifications

  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 years work experience
  • Excellent communication skills


You will be exposed to all facets of the business from sales to operations, which is all valuable career experience if you are thinking about starting a company one day. As we are focused on finding the most talented individuals, we have broadened our search across the US and have planned for this position to be full time telecommute. Experience with remote work or a desire and motivation to work remotely is ideal. Of course, there are important factors like compensation, stock options, and company culture. However, none of this matters unless the above makes career sense for you. Drop us an email if you are a good fit.


This is a full time, permanent role with a competitive salary so candidates must either be a U.S Citizen or have a Green Card.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Distributed technical team and position is full time telecommute
  • We value work/life balance, take as much vacation as you need
  • Comprehensive health, dental & vision
  • 401K plan
  • $ to outfit your home office

Software Engineer

United Kingdom, Belfast

Job Summary

Belfast, United Kingdom

Not Specified

Software Engineer to £40k and reloc assistance if needed. Belfast based and commutable distance.

Expanding company now needs an additional Software Engineer to work on their high speed network systems to the very latest telecoms standards.

Software Engineer

Key Responsibilities:
* Working with marketing to clarify and turn user requirements into UI and software designs.
*Estimating timescales based on an outline of the implementation and then developing and
delivering quality software to those timescales.
*Contributing to the architectural development and evolution of the software to keep it
flexible and maintainable as market requirements evolve.
*Support quality oriented activities necessary to deliver a product that will delight our
customers.
*Learn the domain and hence appreciate the real life use cases of the product features.

Desired Skills, Experience and Qualifications:
Educated to Degree level in one of Software Engineering, Computer Science or an equivalent
subject
*At least 2 years’ experience of full stack application software development using some of: C++, C#/.NET, HTML, JavaScript, TypeScript and CSS. Knowledge and experience of Angular/Angular-JS would be an advantage.

* Experience employing OO techniques and Real Time methods.
*Previous contributor to software architectures and user interfaces.
*Ability to work closely with others in a multi-discipline team.
* Demonstrated ability to respond to tight deadlines in a dynamic environment.

Interested? Then please send your CV ( please use Word – PLEASE AVOID pdf if at all possible ) to me for the Software Engineer vacancy on the email address in this advert. Your CV WILL NOT be sent anywhere without your prior consent

United Kingdom, Lancashire

Job Summary

Lancashire, United Kingdom

Not Specified

Are you looking for new software challenges? Is developing next-generation applications something you could see yourself doing? Does working on projects for some of the largest brands in the UK interest you?

Are you:

* Trained in using C# with over 2 years’ experience?

* Trained and experience in using TDD and Agile?

If so this might be the one for you. . .

I am looking for someone to come into a rapidly growing team and work alongside the Full Stack Engineers. You will be based in Manchester, near Piccadilly Station, but flexibility and remote work is available for those who may struggle with the commute, or prefer that home working lifestyle.

* The salary on offer is £50,000- £60,000 dependent on your skill set and experience. Benefits include your own personal training budget, a bonus scheme and private healthcare.

What will you get up to?

* Deliver Back and Frontend technical solutions

* Develop next-generation web applications and products

* Work with technologies such as C#, MVC & dotnet Core, CI/CD, DevOps & Automation, React, NodeJS

* Participate in all phases of the software engineering life cycle

* Client facing, offering advice and scoping out projects

* Develop and implement new products

* Evaluate new design proposals, and investigate and recommend solutions and process improvements that deliver greater efficiency or performance benefits

If this is something of interest to you then please apply below or alternatively, give Lauren Edwards a call on (phone number removed)

items.content:
Senior Technical Customer Care Analyst at Deltek Inc.

Remote

US Remote

4861BR

Position Responsibilities

Provides application Customer Care to customers, answering complex questions on function and usage of product via the telephone and internet. Serves as primary Customer Care liaison between company and customer. May be required to provide on-call Customer Care on weekends or overnight. Provides work leadership to other Customer Care analysts. Possesses expert knowledge of Deltek’s products used by customers. Operates under general supervision. Typically, reports to the Customer Care Manager.

  • Meets objectives set by Customer Care Manager
  • Provides high quality customer service
  • Mentors other Customer Care analysts
  • Adds information to the knowledge center
  • Be capable of acting as team lead
  • Primarily communicates with immediate Deltek and client peers, project management team, and Deltek and client management Provides Customer Care for customer inquiries received via the telephone and internet

a. Resolve complex customer cases
b. Record detailed notes

  • Actively contributes to the knowledge base and mentors others in this area.
  • Ability to be a Team Lead

Qualifications

Education & Experience:

  • Customer Care: 4-10 years
  • Industry: 5-20 years Bachelors degree or equivalent education

Knowledge & Skills:

  • High level of knowledge of Deltek Software Systems Strong communication, reasoning, and logic skills.
  • Strong team player.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Enjoy learning & expanding one’s horizon.
  • Able to handle multiple tasks at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
  • Superb customer service skills Must have the ability to work independently and be self-motivated.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office applications.
  • 5+ years experience as an accounting Customer Care analyst is highly preferred.
  • General Analytical and technical thinking across multiple areas of responsibility
  • Strong oral and written communication
  • Good presentation skills
  • BA/BS Accounting or related field is preferred.
  • Intermediate to Advanced Database Server Knowledge Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Software Knowledge Intermediate to Advanced IIS and WAN/LAN Security Knowledge Advanced technical troubleshooting skills

Company Summary

Better software means better projects. Deltek is the leading global provider of enterprise software and information solutions for professional services, management and IT consulting, architecture and engineering, marketing and advertising agencies, government contractors and other project-based businesses. More than 23,000 organizations and millions of users in over 80 countries around the world rely on Deltek for superior levels of project intelligence, management and collaboration to research and identify opportunities, win new business, recruit and develop talent, optimize resources and streamline operations. Our industry-focused expertise powers project success by helping firms achieve performance that maximizes productivity and revenue.

Apply for job
